Interview Questions: Do you have children?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview (screening) with recruiter, then the manager and finally a panel interview with the management team.   The phone interview was about 5 minutes in length, told me next steps if I was selected to the next round of interviews.
Interview Questions: My technical background

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The process took around a month, and it consisted of two rounds of interviews. The first round was the usual phone screening. The second round was a video interview that focused on how my experiences demonstrate the skills that they are looking for (leadership, teamwork, etc.) 
The process was great; the internship coordinator takes it serious and she is organized and timely. You are also asked for location preferences during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you completed a very complex project. Explain how you approached it.

title: Prep Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly brief, similar to most interviews I have been too. Spoke about my experience and why I wanted to work for this company as well as my availability. Overall it went well.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work here?

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was professional, followup took a very long time. There were multiple panel interviews with no feedback for over a month.  The interviews involved face to face, tela conference, and on the phone with a key decision mater.
Interview Questions: How I would manage an off site work force.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview after applying three weeks prior online. The panel was two people, the manager and an HR person. They asked basic interview questions and nothing was a surprise, the interview lasted one hour. I was told it would be several weeks before they made their minds up but within four days HR was calling me with an offer. They were very happy to have me.
Interview Questions:
How I worked with a diverse population. 
What I thought the most important part of my role in healthcare is.

title: Training Coordinatir Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and nice. The interviewer was very kind to provide information and was very engaging. It made the whole process very easy and pleasant. Definitely a good start and a good place and people to work with.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Auburn, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It usually is a peer interview, consisting of 3-4 employees that you will be working with. Each employee along with the supervisor will ask a series of questions pertaining to the specifics of the job. They usually will ask you about yourself and what it is about you that would make you an asset.
Interview Questions: What is it that you can bring to the team?

title: Brand Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out to me on LinkedIn. Process was as follows: Had a phone screen with the recruiter, then with one of the marketing directors, and finally had an on-site interview with two marketing directors.  Then, after hearing no feedback for weeks, followed up with the recruiter a couple of times over email and got the runaround (and never any final decision) - very unprofessional, considering that I found out later through the grapevine that a few hires had been made. Luckily, shortly after I found a better job elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you took a risk and what the outcome was

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Emeryville, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then two group interviews. First group interview met entire group in local office. Very impressed with local management in group - very professional and liked her management style - would have enjoyed working for her. Rest of the group were all fairly new employees.  Very disappointed with lack of professionalism of paralegal. Very disappointed with top management from SF. Very disappointed no one spoke up to improper interview question.  At last interview, very very apparent why the position was open.
Interview Questions: What year did you graduate

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Fairly good, like any other job interview you go in and then a manager will call you from the department you applied for and then they gave you an answer within the next couple of days
Interview Questions: Why are you wanting to leave your current job

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: bout 2 weeks. I received a call from HR for an interview. I met with Cassidy Fernandez. Cassidy was very professional and polite. What impressed me the mother was her vast knowledge about the company and her enthusiasm. She had an answer to all of my questions. The interview went smooth and beneficial to both parties. Kudos! To management for having Cassidy in the front line hiring process. She showed great interviewing skills. (After all I got hired!;). After that I used Sutter's website and added my references. The people you list as references have access to the same website  to answer questions about the previous work or personal relationship with the applicant. After that is completed you are either hired or not. Best of luck!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you  talked to an irrate customer and how did you had le it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Vallejo, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Formal panel, very matter of fact lots of behavioral questions. Very professional   and calm. attitude. The whole interview took 25 minutes. They had their poker face and did not give me a clue that I got the job. I got a call a week later.
Interview Questions: My favorite: what three things would your previous boss say about you?

title: File Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor contacted me by phone to set up the initial interview. She received my information from the computer system selecting me according to my on-line application. The supervisor met with me at the first interview, then during the second interview there was another file clerk present. Both of these were comfortable interviews. They were very good to answer my questions, as well. When we were finished I was given a tour of the office and met the team. It showed to be a place that was well coordinated with decent camaraderie between the employees.
Interview Questions: There were some questions of how I stay organized in my duties.

title: EHR Service Desk Tech (Contractor) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online directly through their website, was contacted by a recruiter. I did a technical screen with the technical recruiter via Skype and was moved to a second interview with the hiring manager. The hiring manager I interviewed with stated how exhausted they were, seemed out of focus when speaking with me, eye contact wasn't all there, and seemed to be in a rush. Overall, it was a pretty neutral experience with the direct hiring manager, but was an amazing experience with the recruiter. The recruiter was quick and responsive. The interview with the hiring manager was standard.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what you do at your current job?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Fresno, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Ok, the interview process. Very straight forward, clear, and easy. Everyone was really helpful, especially the recruiter, mine had an awesome Australian accent. He set up an interview with the hiring mgr, an appointment for the health screen and got me onboard as an employee. From applying online to first day of employment was a matter of only less than 30 days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: . I applied for the ED RN position.The Interview was very informal, I met with 2 Nurse ED managers and another co-worker , in an office, almost like a panel interview. The managers were very calm, I was anxious initially then felt relaxed as the interview proceeded. Its was mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
They ask me why I decided to work for Sutter Health
Tell me a bit about yourself
The most outrageous thing that ever happened to you in the ER
How do you to handle conflict

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Davis, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Review of work experience and knowledge going through the resume job duties and skills. Panel interview with 3 interviewers asking questions each asking on skill and experience. each person took notes as questions are being answered. Break down of the position duties that interview for and break down on benefits and pay. Day after interview called from supervisor called offer my self the position. it took 20 day in the whole hiring process. Drug screening background check and health exam.
Interview Questions: what is your experience with Epic, Hippa, patient demographics. etc

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Livermore, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview had 5 people. one doctor, three CLS and one hiring manager. I was totally unprepared for that many people being that it was my second interview I've had in 10 years and my first panel interview. I also took a tour of the laboratory and reviewed what I knew on a clinical level with one of the Clinical Laboratory Scientists. Everyone asked me 2 questions a piece.
Interview Questions: If I am unaware of a lab procedure, what would I do and would I go again protocol?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Redwood City, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called and a message was left on my voicemail. Unfortunately, the return phone number was a generic number for the unit so it was a little difficult to get a hold of the manager. I was interviewed 2 days after the phone call was placed, the interview took about 90 minutes. I received a follow up phone call a few days later with an offer, however didn't accept the offer because of the pay rate.
Interview Questions: The manager kept things professional yet basic. The interviewer only asked questions based around myself and some about my work ethic. The interview itself took close to an hour and a half. I was shown around the department, introduced to the staff and we discussed our history in the medical field, our requirements on both ends for the position, hours, expectations, etc. The interview was very relaxed and the interviewer was quite personable.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Excellent experience involving a wide range of pharmacy, nursing, and physicians.  The experience left me with a strong sense of the value the team places on the contributions that pharmacists make in a hospital setting.  I did not have the right experience to make the cut here, but I will apply again after I have more time at another hospital.
Interview Questions: Very specific situations from my past work history and how they applied to each question.

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (San Francisco, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of open interviews. The interviews were held in a conference room next to the cafeteria in the California Campus. There were many unit managers there to interview candidates one on one. The interviews lasted about ten to fifteen minutes with four to five questions. The experience was short and friendly. They notify applicants through letters of whether they got the position or not.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your nurse to patient interaction.

title: Inpatient Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. In about 3 weeks, I received a phone interview. Then I was offered an onsite interview. The managers were really nice. Questions during my interview were mostly personality questions and questions regarding my background and previous experience.
Interview Questions: Most are situational questions

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and then in person panel interview. The panel interview consist of management and directors. The interview as pretty standard as they asked questions regarding your experience and some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me your experience?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. All behavioral and situational questions. Use examples and reference actual experiences.  Was a very smooth process and the interviewers were wonderful. Not usually a fan of phone interviews but the process was actually smooth.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Checked in front desk for a walk-in interview after finishing my application online.  The lady was super nice and friendly.  She asked me for a cover letter and my resume and I had to answer like 10 questions that were easy to answer.  I took college classes on doing interviews, resumes,  and cover letters and that was one of the best courses I ever took in college.
Interview Questions: What are you're weaknesses?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Really straight forward. They asked a lot of clinical based questions and they like when you draw from your experiences. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. IT also helps to look on their website, they have some example questions and used a couple in the interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time when the group decided upon something that you didn't agree with, but you still went along with it.

title: HIM Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of four people - each person asked one question. All of their questions were behavioral (i.e. "tell me about a time when..."). All of the people were on the younger side and dressed in business casual, so I didn't feel super-intimidated. Because there were only 4 questions, the interview went very quickly.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself."

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was an internal posting, and I applied through the company website. I received notification from the hiring manager that they would like to schedule an interview. After having an interview the hiring manager, I then had a panel interview with 2 supervisors and a manager.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you disagreed with your direct supervisor/manager. What was your reaction? What was the eventual result?

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy application process and smooth interview. Interviewers were kind, professional and courteous. The process is very warm and progressive, would highly recommend to friends to apply. Sutter is a wonderful organization.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in five years?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job. Got a call for a one on one interview 6 months later. Got a call back for panel a few days after one on one. Was offered the job next day.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and weakness?

title: Senior Lean Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job on the Sutter Health.org site. Took many weeks to be notified of an interview opportunity. Interview was a panel of 6. Most of the panel was the team I'd be working with, including the Director. The interview was scheduled for 45 minutes: the first 30 with them asking questions, the last 15 for my questions. There were approximately 10 questions asked of me, mostly scripted behavioral questions. The interview ended on time. Was notified by phone that I did not get the job, "We offered the position to another candidate."
Interview Questions: What is it that brings you to this work? And what excites you about it?

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was originally interviewed by Launch Consulting, the Service Desk's contracting agency. The initial interview with Launch was pretty relaxed with a basic skills test that covered some CMD commands and Windows workflows. A few days later there was a second interview with Sutter and their management which focused on customer service qualities and general personality. The interview process took one week and the onboarding process took three weeks. After a year Sutter offered an internal hire position and the conversion process took three weeks.
Interview Questions: What command can you use to test the network connectivity of a device?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the office manager and the team.  Friendly team and manager was nice. First it was Phone interview with recruiter. Second, one on one and lastly with key team members.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to schedule meetings with Outlook?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: For the position of the Medical assistant, a recruiter calls and confirms the interest in the position. Then they schedule you for a skills assessment prior to the interview. If you pass, they forward your information to the hiring manager. The interview was panel style. the Supervisor, lead and an MA. Most of the questions were scenario questions and they requested answers on what you have done and not what would you do.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had a disagreement with management's decision on something, what did you do or how did you handle it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 3 weeks after receiving the first phone call to the phone call with telling me i did not get the offer. The process was very straight to the point. I was first contacted by the HR department then I was scheduled a phone interview with one of the leading doctors on the case.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience in a research lab?

title: CNA/HHA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel/friendly - it was not in 2015, but in 2008. I am currently employed there, but looking at other opportunities for employment. I have little time and need to get ready to leave now.
Interview Questions: What to do in emergency

title: Chief Operating Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Formal meeting with HR, Finance and Operational leadership.  Purposeful and direct, yet also very engaging and inclusive environment. While not explicit, they are seeking good cultural fit, not just skills and abilities.
Interview Questions: How do you lead change.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Salt Lake City, UT) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I originally went through Prince & Perelson which I would NOT recommend to anyone!  DO NOT GO THROUGH A TEMP AGENCY. It was a irritating and lengthy process to finally become full on and I could have been earning bonuses but couldn't. When I finally became an employee I had to reapply but did not have to redo an Interview.
Interview Questions: What was a hard situation at work which you have dealt with and how?

title: Lean Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Mountain View, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard for the industry.  Describe previous work history, past projects that were successful and failed, meet with a few leaders and colleagues, why do you want to work for company, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for company?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel, good questions mostly on the behavioral side.  Prepare your answers as most of the questions surround how you work with others, describe actual situations for the questions. Practice youranswers so they roll off very natural.
Interview Questions: Tell me aboutatime when you made a mistake, how did you handle it?  How do you like to be managed?  How would you handle a coworker who was creating problems.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 5 panel interview it was nice the people who interviewed me was nice it took like 45 min interview I was so prepared they I was nervous at fisrt but after that i did good the next day they called  me for another interview with the MD and I did good then that day they offered me the job
Interview Questions: what is pace rpogram

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: It was three week process, they background check, and criminal check. You interview two to three times and after its paid training for three weeks. The training is good but boring.
Interview Questions: how did you hear about us?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview in the cafeteria. Sort of a busy and strange place for all the personal discussion that occurs during an interview.  One person even sat down at the table I was sitting at and watched videos on his phone while I answered all the questions from the panel members at the other table.  No one said anything, he just stayed there watching his phone for 20 minutes!  All in all it was an experience I've never had before.  I am re-leaved in a way that I didn't get the job, what kind of workplace environment would it be???
Interview Questions: How would you introduce yourself on the first day to the other workers?????

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy and comfortable. I was interviewed by two of our three bosses. I left the interview with a smile and a good feeling about the outcome. Sure enough, about a week later I got a call from HR with a job offer!!!!
Interview Questions: No tricks, just basic interview questions.Both bosses were great, We talked, laughed, AND interviewed at the same time. Painless!

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview; Maybe an hour long. Wide range of questions. A word of advice: check out Sutter's website, as it has a GREAT list of potential interview questions that you can use to mentally prepare yourself for the interview. Clinical scenario question felt intense-- think about your C-ABCDE (etc.) process, and you should be okay. Everyone I spoke to about the interview (who was hired) also thought they interviewed horribly, so don't feel too bad if you walk out feeling like you failed miserably.
Interview Questions: Scenario with admission that suddenly becomes unstable.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: My friend had referred me and I got an interview the next day after emailing my resume to a department manager. The interview went well. Interviewed with two nice ladies. They made it very calm and comfortable. The interview lasted 30 mins (they usually last about 10) she was really into talking to me and discussing her future plans for herself personally -I really thought and believed I did good. They then said that I will hear back on Wednesday (interviewed Tuesday). 3 Wednesdays passes by and I haven't heard anything. I emailed a thank you letter a week after- still no answer. The third week I sent a follow up letter and still no reply. I just wish they had a way of letting you know if you got the job or not. Whether it's a phone call or a automated email saying you didn't pass the interview.
Interview Questions: Why Sutter?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Dept Manager and Assistant Manager on the same day.  They asked me questions, mostly, targeted toward my work history.   Other questions were to determine what skills I had acquired in my previous roles.
Interview Questions: Describe an interaction you had with a difficult co worker.  How did you work through the issue?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Could be up to four rounds and  ten people, providing a good cross-section of employees at different levels, with an equal and balanced focus on  culture fit, technical knowledge, organizational dynamics. There were no case studies.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge you faced and how did you determine your approach to solving it?

title: ISC Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was in a room with 6 managers and they were shooting questions at me. They really were vague on the job qualifications and one of the managers could not get off of the excel project process.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a shortcut that you have used on excel

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with two people. Took notes on laptops.     After interview they send a link for your references to fill out about you.  Interviewers were friendly. Stressed importance of call times and metrics.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What do you know about our company?

title: Content Management Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Friendly atmosphere, no stress and warm environment such as:
Describe a situation you successfully persuaded someone to see things your way.
Tell me about a time when you had too many things to do and you were required to prioritize your tasks.
Give me an example of a time when you set a goal and were able to meet or achieve it.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and job related questions

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: You meet the managers and the supervisors for the first and only one on one interview. If hired, you get an acceptance letter and the step by step of the required hiring stages. Once you submit and meet the requirements, you are given an offer letter and your day of reporting.
Interview Questions: What makes you feel you are fit for this job?

title: RN Staff Nurse- ED Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they called me to schedule the interview, The interview lasted  20-25 min. I one if the shortest interviews I have participated in. It was a 3 person panel interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about your favorite patient

title: Patient Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Arrived, left my name with the front and was called in by the director after ten minutes or so. Was interviewed by the Head of the Department and Director of the Building. They had my resume in hand as they asked me questions about myself and why I wanted to work there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Murray, UT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process has changed since I started there. I believe they actually do video interviews now and also there are a couple more steps. They also hire through a staffing agency as well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Billing Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Murray, UT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Questions related to past experiences related to the job and having me go over how I would use current knowledge to handle situations that come up in the job
Interview Questions: Questions about past  customer service and medical background and a few scenario questions

title: Staff Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application with no word for a few weeks. Had phone interview, then a week later called in and had first and second interview same day with 2 different people.
Interview Questions: tell me something about yourself, why do you want to work for sutter. What experience do you have.

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was extremely fast because there was an initiative that needed to start on a specific date. It took two weeks from first interview date to start date. Although there was time constraints the admin was helpful in scheduling time around my availability.  Human resources contacted my referrals immediately and upon accepting the offer gave me detailed instructions on next steps.
Interview Questions: How do I handle ambiguity.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received the interview through a staffing agency called K Force the following day after the interview I heard back from Sutter and I was not selected. It was a panel of two women both women were very nice and friendly however they were only looking to hire about four or five people it is very important that you know some medical terminology such as HMO, PPO, and EPO and information about medicare
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews first interview was one on one with a regional manager, second interview was with office manager, LVN and 2 medical assistants. They then call you and let you know if you got the job or not. If you get the job they then send you to Novato for computer training.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you, what can you offer us at Sutter Health, describe a difficult patient and how you handled the situation, what are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a call 4 days later. Went to the interview and I was expecting questions about the unit I applied for but they asked basic interview questions. They explained the whole hiring process to me and told me I would be contacted through HR about their decision. Received an email the following week saying that the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Healthcare Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Murray, UT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: A group of interviewees facing  a panel of interviewers. We introduced ourselves. They asked a couple of  group questions and then individual questions, then we were given a chance to ask questions.
Interview Questions:
What is some constructive feedback you have received from your superiors?
When did you have an opportunity to take on a leadersip role and what happened?
how do you prioritize your workload?

title: Project Coordinator () Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great initial meetings with team in Natomas office. Had offer made to me through one staffing agent and then continued to interview with another agency for other positions I was more interested in.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Know Your Stuff! Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard, turned in an application and received a call just a few days later. Met with a recruiter, whose job it is to make you feel you are important and a really good candidate (so don't be fooled) :) The recruiter said they would get back with me several weeks ago, and even though I have attempted to contact they are always unavailable.
Interview Questions: Know everything on your resume! I was grilled on nearly all aspects from positions, duties, accomplishments, even dates of employment!

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (North Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They have you do tests before an interview. The math test is easy but the other is hard unless you're right out of school. They ask a lot of questions study very gard
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to schedule an interview which was a week later. I went in and gave them my resume and other items they asked for(Certs) I then was called in and it was basically a skills test to see what clinical skills I had such as picking the right medication. I was given scenarios and asked what I would do in that situation. I was handed a syringe and told to put such and such amount of air in the syringe. And then asked a few questions about what type of worker my coworkers would say I am. I was then told to wait outside the room and wait for an HR rep to come get me.  I was then taken to another room and offered a position and instructions on what comes next.  I stressed over it  alot more than I needed to.
Interview Questions: If my former coworkers were asked what am I like to work with, what would they say?

title: Diagnostic Imaging Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called me to verify my interest in the position. Then they set up an interview a for a couple weeks later. I had to go online and complete some task prior to my interview. Went in for my interview and was offered the job a few says later. Then there were more pre-employment tasks for me to complete prior to my start date.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with another co-worker? If so, had did you resolve ita?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It’s not that long. Only had to do one interview . It takes a little bit for the background check to come back because they are in the healthcare field.
Interview Questions: How would you handle certain situations

title: PHARMACST Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, panel - approximately 1 hour in duration.  Friendly experience.  Each panel member took turns asking questions.  Approximately 4 individuals were involved in the panel.  Surprisingly, they only required a phone interview and did not need to interview me face to face.
Interview Questions: Traditional scenario type question.

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by recruiter after applying online.The recruiter scheduled a Phone screen. Typical screening questions. I was contacted 2 months later for the panel interview with Sr Leadership. Panel interview was straight forward no difficult questions. Mostly behavior style questions
Interview Questions: What type of Management style do you prefer?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First had a phone interview asking the typical interview questions (why this job? why health care? etc.)
After about a week I got invited to an in person interview. 2 hour interview process. Had a 90 minute exercise that tested word applications knowledge. Afterwards, had to present the work from the exercise to a panel and then finished off with a panel interview.
Interview Questions: What was an uncomfortable situation you have been in and how did you handle it? What is your greatest accomplishment? Do you value quality of work or quantity (getting it all done in time)?

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Face to face at company facility. Interviewer explained what functions were at the location, what the duties of the position were, and what would be expected of employees in the position. Interviewer also explained how their new process was implemented and how it was working so far.
Interview Questions: What is your experience level and what were some of your daily job duties?

title: Home Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Alameda, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy and simply. Applied  the company called the next day . Interviewed and orientation the following week. Simple questions and tests. Then background check and orientation with a group of other people. 8 hr orientation
Interview Questions: How to you handle a stressful situation?

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application on their website, one of over 100 I have submitted and was called for an interview. I sat in front on a panel of 4 ladies and was interviewed in tandem by them all. It was a little awkward trying to maintain eye contact and feel confident with 4 people staring at you.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't a difficult question

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went there pretty early and went to a coffee bar a little bit. then i went to the conference room there are 3 people together. asked a lot of questions. the whole process was around 39 mins. no pressure at all .at last i was told to go home waiting for reply
Interview Questions: why you choose this job

title: Director, Non-clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: First call was with human resources as a phone interview, VP interview and then panel interview. There were four people on the panel interview. First call was with human resources as a phone interview, VP interview and then panel interview. There were four people on the panel interview.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were scenarios.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: At the time I applied for the job, the clinic had just barely merged with Sutter, so my comments can't be viewed as representative of Sutter. A friend of mind who is a doctor at the practice, invited me to apply so I did. I interviewed with 3 doctors and one nurse, but not as a group. The interviews were 1:1.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply here?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Davis, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 2 months for the call for an interview. Interviewed with two people manager and Housekeeping lead. Manager was really nice but the lead was really uninterested. Two days later I get a email stating the position was filled. I called the manager she stated they went with someone else. I felt the interview was a waist of time and they knew who they was going to go with before I interviewed.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in housekeeping

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (San Jose, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: multiple requests for return interviews all of which lasted between 3 and 6 hours without any guidance as to requirements and the software for negotiating the application process took multiple attempts with over 28 hours required for correcting and re correcting mistakes made by the internal computer processing of the application.  AT least messages left for help were returned within 48 hours.
Interview Questions: how much experience have you had within your field?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 panel interviews and a one on one with the hiring director. About 6 people on each panel. It was a long process from the time I applied. About 2 months. Be prepared to answer many questions from all people on the panel. I would say out of all of the places I have interviewed, it wasn't the hardest, but it wasn't the easiest either. They did really pick apart my resume. Mostly to see if it was accurate.
Interview Questions: Most questions were situational. How I would handle difficult situations.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with hiring Supervisor and staff. Interview was held on-site. The interview lasted one hour with the hiring Supervisor and 30-45 minutes with the department staff. The interviewer had a prepared list of questions that he asked every candidate. The staff interview as less informal, and was geared to personality and character fir into the department. A follow-up for the decision process was communicated to take about one week.
Interview Questions: Experience specific

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very thorough.  Was asked to provide a web-based video interview as a screening step - then interviewed with recruiter, hiring manager, executive team and had 2 panel interviews.  The staff seemed prepared and engaged in the interview process.
Interview Questions: This question was unexpected:  what could your current employer do differently to keep you from leaving?

title: Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Crescent City, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview- round robin questions. In my case, the interview was held over the phone via a conference call due to the remote location of the affiliate (Crescent City, CA) versus the location of the main offices (Sacramento, CA). The questions focused on my clinical experience and what I could bring to the table by working in informational services.
Interview Questions: Are you ready to transition away from bedside nursing?

title: EBA Specialist Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Murray, UT) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: First it was a phone interview. Then after that if was a video interview that WA taped and recorded. They a group interview at the facility with 5 other interviewees.
Interview Questions: Why do you like helping people.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on-site and the interview took 10-15 minutes. Met with one HR person and she asked somewhere between 5 to 10 questions. The questions were primarily related to customer service and a little about my previous experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle speaking with someone who is upset or frustrated?

title: Account Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Complete online application, get a call from manager/phone interview and lastly in person interview.

This process took a very long time. Also I hadn't been briefed before coming for my in person that I would be meeting the entire team.

I thought this would just be meeting the hiring manager and getting a feel for it. Then the 2nd meeting would be a panel. I wished I had known it was. Combined interview so I was better prepared.
Interview Questions: Had the whole team interview me

title: Health Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: got email from a recruiter and set up interview with her. Interviewer was very friendly, and nice. asked basic question about past experience and some behavioral questions. what changes want to make.
Interview Questions: Interviewer was very friendly, and nice. asked basic question about past experience and some behavioral questions. what changes want to make.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: For the most part the hiring and interview process was pretty standard. What they seemed to be looking for was experience versus any degrees that you currently hold. The questions that they asked were very straight forward and there were a few questions where they asked some "get to know you" type questions to see if you were someone that would fit into the company atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What would you say is one of your flaws? and How would you deal with a difficult coworker/peer/manager?

title: LinkAges Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sutter Health (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Process took about a week for somebody to call me for an interview. Met with two people and they were all fairly nice. Asked questions about my work experience and how it relates to the position. Asked about specific job experiences and what I accomplished and what challenges I had. Asked many questions about team work and working in groups and how I overcame challenges for that as well.
Interview Questions: What duties did you have during a specific volunteer experience?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Rancho Cordova, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of phone interview with recruitment manager, interview with hiring manager, and several panels. The recruitment manager was very thorough, asked very thoughtful questions, and accurately represented the organization, culture, and challenges of the role. Panel process was not very appealing-too many people that didn't seem completely engaged. Interviewing should marketing on both sides.
Interview Questions: How would you affect change with an organization with a strong culture and somewhat set ways for running the business?

title: Quality Review and Risk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via phone for an interim management position.  Thorough reference check, basic orientation done on the fly by director and human resources due to vacations.  Hired as interim manager while company actively recruits for the position. Company transparent about this being a high turnover position with extremely poor retention of employees in the department.
Interview Questions: What can you do to help us improve retention ?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Emeryville, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen, then a group interview with my prospective team, then a one-on-one with the Chief Executive of that team, then another group interview.  All the interviews were in-depth and lengthy.  I learned a lot about the team and the company in that time.  All in all it took more than 3 months.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working independently?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Many many applicants per position, helps to know someone already working in the department. Initially apply online and complete questionnaires about work history and experience. If pass online questionnaires, then application forwarded to department management. Initial interview with department managers, second and sub-sequential interviews usually with peer staff members in collaboration with management.
Interview Questions: What is your approach to your personal workload and the workload of others?

title: Accounting Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through my school for an internship with Sutter and heard back from them a little over month and a half. The interview was pretty typical, had questions about my customer service experience, why do I want to study accounting, etc. Overall, it has been a good experience and I am happy that they wanted me to join their team.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of ordinary, just questions of why you would be a good fit, why do you want to study accounting, etc.

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (West Valley City, UT) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Email confirmation and set up through phone call. Interview was easy and enjoyable, but did not prepare me for what to expect on the job. I did have to drug test. One nice things is if you miss the call, they will leave a voicemail and try again. It's not like other employers if you miss the call that's your only chance.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this company?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was 2 day process , also involved meeting and lunch with peers which was good to get questions answered. Went over the organization and answered questions and concerns. Also had chance to see clinic area and setting . Asked about skill set and expectation.
Interview Questions: average patient load managed

title: Accounting Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: I was able to get this position through an acquaintance. The questions I got asked were pretty typical : Tell me about yourself? Why do you think you would be a good fit? What are your past experiences?
Interview Questions: Why work in healthcare?

title: Administrative Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Onsite at my school with one of the preceptors for the 3 different internships. it was very smooth. they have since changed the process to make it more formalized and they now interview folks from all over the country for the summer intern positions.
Interview Questions:
experience? 
behavioral questions

title: Implementation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions:
- Easy interview process consisted of 1 phone screen and 1 45min in-person interview
- Recruiter was not responsive and did not show up for initial scheduled phone call
Interview Questions:
- No difficult questions. All pretty standard behavioral questions specific to the job.
- Example what are 2-3 qualities that make a good trainer and why

title: Dermatologist/Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process but long - 2 days in total. They cover all expenses and reimburse everything as well. My husband was able to travel with me for the interviews and expenses were covered for him also. First day: Tour of clinic and several meetings (both group and one-on-one) with internal medicine and Derm dpt. Last interview session is 1 hour and is a behavioral interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you disagreed with your boss and what you did in that situation. What did you learn from it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Rancho Cordova, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview, then a face to face with the Director of a department. Then interviewed by a panel, including several people from different locations that were brought in via video conferencing. Each experience was very positive. The interviewers worked hard at putting me at ease. Very professional, friendly atmosphere.
Interview Questions: All were very common interview questions. They did ask me "to walk them through my resume".

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was quick and easy. Went to panel interview, went well. Was told would find result in 2 weeks minimum. Follow up for two week, all I got was the run around. After 2 months, received a generic email stating a better candidate was selected.
Interview Questions: What is your daily production?

title: Claims Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy.  They asked the basic questions.  Interviewed by 2 people, and then was called five minutes later to interview with another.  After the interview I was called in by another person on the other side of the building who asked me how I felt the interview went and they had me sign a form to run background check
Interview Questions: what makes you qualified, what can you bring to the team, How have you handled a situation with a coworker

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was like any other I had a phone interview and then received a call from the hiring manager. I had a panel interview for this position since i would be working with different vendors.
Interview Questions: How do I feel I will contribute my skills to this position.

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I have been trying to get on with Sutter Health for over a year. I had been called in to panel interviews at 3 different locations. The last one was at the location on F Street in East Sac. While all the interviews went well, I wasn't selected for reasons that weren't explained to me. My last panel interview went very well. It was pretty standard without any "gotcha" questions. I was told that they had to interview other people, and that they would be getting back to me soon. I figured that was another rejection so I was very surprised when they called me while I was on my way home to tell me I got the job. I am so looking forward to working there, and hope to show them I am a valuable employee who brings their best to every task given.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult of unexpected questions. I've heard a few in other interviews like "What are you passionate about?" Sheesh!

title: ETL Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It went fine. Had 4 people on the call. call was focused more on leadership , people management abilities
Interview Questions: how would handle difficult person in your team

title: Infrastructure PM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Mather, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Inistial interview in phone. Fairly short, but to the point.  Got immediate feedback as to how I did.  Feed back was good which led me to think I'd make it to the next round which I did.  In person interview was within 2 weeks and had representatives from 3 areas relating to the position.  Process was quite informal and also went well.  Withing 10 day received an offer which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Most unexpected thing that happened was that the hiring mgr for this position attended the final in person interview and just commented that we had already spoken as he did the previous phone interview, and that he didn't need to ask anymore questions as he was satisfied with my previous answers and he was okay with me as far as he was concerned.

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Mather, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a joke.  In my case, the interviewer had no clue what Project Management really is or how to identify a skilled project manager.  I interviewed for other Sutter Health FTE positions while contracting.  Those interviews were better, but still mostly very general.  The hiring managers are not very adept at knowing how to identify and hire resources best suited to growing the organization.  Often, the hiring manager is too busy and would send a junior team member to conduct the interview.
Interview Questions: Very basic interview questions, essentially reiterating the same information presented on my resume.

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: Was an online interview through webcam. Not very friendly and quite  intimidating. microphone was not clear at all in their end and they asked very random questions not relating to programming at all
Interview Questions: Testing different types of case studies when my position encompassed programming

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. There is really no wrong awnser. It is usually over the phone, however my experience was in person. They basically just want to know the reason you want to volunteer at their hospital. There is no stress or complications, everything went smoothly and a lot of good help from the volunteer services.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer?

title: Clinical Nurse Resident (New Grad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with 6 people, including residency manager, a charge nurse and an assistant manager, and a couple nurse educators. 

Each panel member asked one question from  scripted paper in turn. At the end the panel was given an opportunity to ask questions. It happened to be the two people in the department I was hired for were the ones to ask additional questions. One focused on my past work experience, the other asked about an internship project.
Interview Questions: Tell me an example of dealing with a difficult patient/physician

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Roseville, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy, this wasn't difficult, the interview was basically informal. They asked basic questions and more of behavioral questions. I spoke with one of the leads and they were really chill and easy going.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: EHR Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sutter Health
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews back to back. 1st one with management the 2nd with the leads for the EHR Service desk. Pretty general questions about IT stuff from the technicians. Management just asked general question like why do you want to work here etc.
Interview Questions: I didn't encounter anything crazy. Just your standard IT questions.

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process does not take too long, about 3-4 weeks to get an interview. You meet with person who is in the current role and then the doctor you are working with and then the hiring manager. Very smooth process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at sutter?

title: Hopital Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Called me back a long while after I applied. I almost forgot I had applied. Came in for a 5 person panel interview and aced it. Invited the same day to come back the next day for another interview. Aced it and offered position on drive home. Started my process with employee health and was working within 2 weeks or less.
Interview Questions: None really, just typical questions about strengths and weaknesses and prior experience. one or two "Name a time when..." questions.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: You were questioned by about 5 people form the office. They asked multiple questions that were pertinent to this job position. They also reviewed your resume. It was slightly stressful since there were multiple people in the room interviewing you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this office?

title: Director of Risk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: questions related to job qualifications as well as experience with claims, loss runs, insurance.  experience with physicians, clinicians, and teams.  strengths and weakness, dealing with confrontation, dysfunctional teams, problematic employee.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for Sutter?

title: Clerical Support Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Murray, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
I was called & did a quick on the spot phone interview, questions like:
Whats your ideal working enviorment? Whats your most greatest accomplishment at your most recent job?  what do you think is most needed in the workplace  for you 2 be happy.
then called in with 2 peop
Interview Questions: If you were interviewing a potential canidate, what would be more important , attitude or knowledge and why?

title: HMO PPO Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: A little tence which is expeted and with a great suppervisor and staff members that were in the panel. I have a wonderful job and plan on staying here as long as I can.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: AR II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, Manager called me... went in for a interview and was hired about 4 weeks later.
Interview Questions: N/a- easy questions.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was initiated by department admin, throughout the whole process I did not have any interaction with a recruiter or someone from HR until the end when I got a boiler plate thank you for applying email.  The process started with a group phone interview, followed by a panel interview, followed by another panel interview and ended with a skills test and the process is dragged out between multiple days requiring to take a decent amount of time off if you are currently working.  All the questions are very engaging, open ended analytic in nature and throughout the dialogue you gain a good sense of the role and responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Sutter?

title: Supervisor Position Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: phone screen, 1:1 screen with direct hiring supervisor, followed by 2 panel interviews- 1 with management and 1 with direct reports. The recruitment team needed to do background checks on any country you've lived in for more than 4 months, this process delayed my start date by nearly one month. They only have orientation sessions every 2 weeks which can also delay start dates.
Interview Questions: tell us about a time where you had to deal with a difficult employee

title: Facilities Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Came in as a temp. Then there was no interview, but once you start on as a permitted employee, you must pass a background check, drug test and physical. Other departments have a phone interview, then a one on one, then a panel interview.
Interview Questions: None, I started as a contractor through a local temp agency. Not the type that has a rediculious amount of perks.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Emeryville, CA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter and director didn't seem very organized and were on two different schedules. The recruiter insisted that they should have the chosen candidate by the end of the week after I interviewed but the director said it should take at least 3 weeks. 

After playing phone tag with the recruiter on the initial set up of the interview we finally got in touch, mostly technical questions were asked leading me to be in the top 4 candidates chosen. The interview with the director went pretty smooth and no challenging questions were asked in which I prepared for. After consistently checking up with both the recruiter and director they ensured to keep me up to date on the decision making process. During the fourth week the recruiter didn't return my call or e-mail so I ended up frantically searching for jobs again, to my amazement they had re-posted the job that they had taken down 3 weeks prior. Since there were only 3 other candidates I felt deceived that I wasn't even notified about the process taking longer than originally planned. 

The sixth week is when I got a generic "this position is no longer available" e-mail. I wrote the recruiter to thank her for her time and she wrote back a snobbish letter in which I thought was very unprofessional. Doubt I'll ever look at Sutter Care at Home job opportunities again due to the ill and unprofessional treatment of the recruiter.
Interview Questions: What transferable skills from previous experience can you apply to this position?

title: Systems Engineer III Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Rancho Cordova, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was called for a phone interview with the hiring manager.  My technical skills were explained and he thoroughly enjoyed my background on various items.  He informed me that a further one-on-one interview would be necessary with a panel of technical folks.

On the day of the one-on-one interview I arrived at the location on time.  I was escorted and taken to a conference room where there was a panel of people with various technical expertises from Web Developers, Production Support, Managers and Engineers.  Most of the panel were men along with only one female.  Various questions were asked from windows IIS servers, Weblogic, Database and Linux/Unix.  I felt confident about my answers.  At the end of the first round, I was taken to another waiting area and was asked to wait around 15 minutes for them to decide if I made it to the second round.

After 15 minutes, the hiring manager came to escort me out of the building, he proceeded to explain that I didn’t qualify for the position because I didn’t have enough Windows 2008 Server experience along with IIS 7 which I found it almost laughable since his staff learned the technology four months before my interview.  Usually my experience on Unix/Linux is a demonstration that I can learn just about any operating system but that was not the case here.  Windows trumped Unix?  When has anyone seen that before?    The hiring manager seemed very heart broken that his staff of technical folks didn’t want to proceed with a second interview which lead me to believe that something else was at work.  To be told that I was not technical enough because I didn’t know one piece of a technology is a flat out lie and that leads me to believe they were making an excuse.

I got the impression that this is a Good O Boys shop.  There was only one woman in the interview panel which was a Manager and I didn’t see many women working in the Information Technology building.  I’ve never heard of a job that requires people to know exactly every piece of Technology and not be given an opportunity to learn new items on the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Strategic Planning Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sutter Health (Sacramento, CA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Very laborious process.  They had my resume for about 4 months before they called.  Started with a phone interview with the hiring manager.  That went well so I was invited for a 1:1 interview.  That also went well and I had good rapport with the hiring manager.  He asked me to appear for a panel interview which got a bit riduculous.  There were 6 people present in the room and three others attended from another office location via teleconference.  Nine people...barely enough time for each person to ask one question, and I never knew where the next question was coming from.  I felt like I was being vetted for the supreme court.  This was for an upper level analytical position; individual contributor...not even a manager or director.  I felt it was overkill.  Furthermore, I didn't have good rapport with some of the folks in the room.  Manager called a few days later and offered me the job.  I was surprised...didn't think the panel had gone well, but boss obviously liked me well enough to (perhaps) overrule them.  Since no one from the team I would be working with directly was part of the panel, and since I was on the fence (liked the boss but maybe not the larger group) about the position, I asked to be able to meet with the team I'd be working with to help make up my mind.  Not sure what the boss told them; again, I had already been offered the job.  They put me in another panel with the team (three of them vs. me...and it was "versus") and the team grilled me hard.  I wanted to laugh and say, 'you guys know that I've been offered the job and I'm trying to decide, right?'

I ended up accepting the offer after making some demands and it worked out fine, although I was right about some of the folks on the panel.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were asked to present unpopular data/findings; how you did it; what the outcome was; what you would do differently; etc.

title: Senior Project Planning Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions:
A few days after applying online I received an email requesting a phone screening interview.  After the phone interview we scheduled a panel interview for the following week.

The panel interviewers consisted of 5 people from the team, i.e., people the candidate would actually work with.  The representation were three peers, the director, and the manager (who conducted the phone interview).

All of the interviewers were very nice and demeanor was comforting (even when I answered a question incorrectly, they didn't make me feel stupid about it).  

The office, which is located off Hwy 50, is beautiful and comfortable.  I was in the lobby/waiting area for about 20 mins and noticed the people entering and leaving the building.  They all looked happy and all greeted the security guard by first name.
Interview Questions: How do you edit a project plan in MS Project?
